0.name: Choose the correct method to add an element to the end of the array.

1.name: Choose the correct method to add an element to the beginning of the array.

2.name: What is passed as an argument to the push() and unshift() methods?

3.name: How many arguments can be passed to push() and unshift() methods?

4.name: What types of data can be passed as arguments to the push() and unshift() methods?

5.name: After the push() method is executed, the length of the array is increased by the number of elements passed.

6.name: What happens to the array after the unshift() method is executed?

0.name: The length of the array remains the same and the elements at the beginning of the array are replaced by the new ones

1.name: The length of the array is increased by the number of elements passed and the indexes are overwritten

2.name: The length of the array is increased by the number of elements passed and the indexes remain the same

3.name: The length of the array remains the same, but the indices are overwritten

7.name: What happens after the push() method is executed?

0.name: The length of the array will increase by the number of elements passed, the indexes will not be overwritten

1.name: The length of the array will be increased by the number of elements passed, and the indexes will be overwritten

2.name: The length of the array will remain the same, the indexes will not be overwritten

3.name: The length of the array will increase by the number of elements passed, the index numbering will start from the end

8.name: Select the correct index for the 'Mary' element after executing the unshift() method

9.name: Select the correct index for the 'Mary' element after running the push() method
